channel.title: Math53 Zettelkasten on
channel.description: Recent content in Math53 Zettelkasten on

item.description: A region $D \subset \mathbb{R}^2$ is x-simple (y-simple) if every horizontal (vertical) line intersects $D$ in a line segment. A region is said to be “simple” if it is both x-simple and y-simple.

item.title: Chain rule
item.description: Idea:

item.title: Clairaut's Theorem
item.description: Idea:

item.title: Conservative
item.description: idea: The existence of [[Derivative]] to be integrated in [[Fundamental Theorem of Calculus]] A [[Vector field]] $\vec{F}$ is conservative if there exists a [[Scalar function]] $f$ such that $\nabla f = \vec{F}$ (see [[Gradient]])

item.title: Derivative
item.description: Idea: [[Gradient]]

item.title: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
item.description: #ideas Integral of [[Derivative]] over a region = function over a boundary Sum up the total weight or amount of a function described in input space.

item.title: Gradient
item.description: idea: Expand the definition of [[Derivative]] in [[Fundamental Theorem of Calculus]] Take the [[Derivative]] of a [[Scalar function]] $f$ ([[Mapping]]: $R^{n}\to R$) to get a [[Vector field]] $\vec{F}$ ([[Mapping]]: $R^{n}\to R^{n}$)

item.title: Green's Theorem
item.description: Idea: [[Fundamental Theorem of Calculus]] Suppose $\vec{F}(x,y)=(P,Q)$ Let $C$ be a positively oriented (see [[Orientation]]), piecewise-smooth, simple closed curve surrounding region $A$.

item.title: Jacobian Matrix
item.description: Idea: [[Map]] Reserved for [[Mapping]] from nD to nD

item.title: Line Integral
item.description: Idea: [[Fundamental Theorem of Calculus]] 1D to 1D Integrate a [[Scalar function]] over a 1D object in input space, object living in 1D output space

item.title: Magic factor
item.description: Idea:

item.title: Map
item.description: Mapping/transformation from $n$ dimension to $m$ dimension.

item.title: Mapping
item.description: Idea: [[Map]] from nD to mD from 1D to 1D $x=x(t)$ if $x(t)=t$, then $\mathrm{d}x=\mathrm{d}t$ [[Magic factor]]$=1$ from 1D to 2D Curve $C$ is given by $\vec{r}(t)=(x(t), y(t))$

item.title: Orientation
item.description: Idea: Closed Curve Counterclockwise as positive direction, clockwise as negative direction. If $C$ is given by the vector function $\vec{r}(t), a\le t\le b$ then the region $D$ is always on the left as the point $\vec{r}(t)$ traverses $C$.

item.title: Path-independent
item.description: Idea: If the boundary in [[Fundamental Theorem of Calculus]] is the same, then the integral of derivative over a region should be the same.

item.title: Scalar function
item.description: Idea: [[Map]] $R^{n}\to R$

item.title: Stoke's Theorem
item.description: Idea:

item.title: Surface Integral
item.description: Idea: [[Fundamental Theorem of Calculus]] (Or Area integral) The relationship between surface integrals and surface area is much the same as the relationship between line integrals and arc length.

item.title: Tangential compenent
item.description: Idea:

item.title: Vector field
item.description: Idea: [[Map]] $R^{n}\to R^m$ [[Conservative]]

item.title: Vector line integral
item.description: Idea: [[Fundamental Theorem of Calculus]] integrate the [[Vector field]] $\vec{F}$ over the curve $C$, where $\vec{F}(x, y)=\left(f_{1}(x, y), f_{2}(x, y)\right)$
